posts.post_content:
All Planeswalkers shall kneel before the omnipotent Lord Bolas.  
  
If you would so foolishly choose not to, then your very existence is hereby forfeit, as Lord Bolas has no need for those who would defy his insurmountable might.  
  
So make like [Sarkhan the Mad](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sarkhan the Mad) and [Tezzeret, Agent of Bolas](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tezzeret, Agent of Bolas). Join the legions of Lord Bolas.  
  
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------  
  
@adrian.malacoda While Yawgmoth is certainly a terrifyingly evil being, Lord Bolas is leaps and bounds above the man who once ruled over Phyrexia. Having lived both before and after Yawggy is just one of many examples, though I will admit even Lord Bolas' powers would be tested if he were to be challenged by Urza. At any rate though, Lord Bolas is a superior villain.
posts.html:
All Planeswalkers shall kneel before the omnipotent Lord Bolas.

Thank goodness he was recently reprinted in Adjani vs Nicol Bolas set, keeping his price under relative control. Why would you pay $30-40.00 for a single copy of him when you could buy a single copy of him plus many other useful cards in the aforementioned set?

Posted By: MechaKraken (6/13/2012 8:59:42 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Another storyline thought:   
There's 3 major evils running around in Magic right now: Bolas, Eldrazi, and Phyrexia. What makes Bolas stand out is he is keeping tabs on the other two, which both happen to be world-consuming evils.   
  
Tezzeret is on New Phyrexia to "Prevent leadership from taking hold", While Sarkhan was sent to Zendikar to awaken the Eldrazi, all Bolas's plans.   
  
Could it be that Nicol Bolas, being the manipulator of worlds that he is, is going to use the other superevils to carry out his own schemes? Or maybe he's going to pit them against each other, the Phyrexians vs the Eldrazi, to see which world-destroying evil is the most powerful...And therefore the most fitting for him to direct to his own purposes?
posts.html:
Another storyline thought:
There's 3 major evils running around in Magic right now: Bolas, Eldrazi, and Phyrexia. What makes Bolas stand out is he is keeping tabs on the other two, which both happen to be world-consuming evils.

Tezzeret is on New Phyrexia to "Prevent leadership from taking hold", While Sarkhan was sent to Zendikar to awaken the Eldrazi, all Bolas's plans.

Could it be that Nicol Bolas, being the manipulator of worlds that he is, is going to use the other superevils to carry out his own schemes? Or maybe he's going to pit them against each other, the Phyrexians vs the Eldrazi, to see which world-destroying evil is the most powerful...And therefore the most fitting for him to direct to his own purposes?

posts.post_content:
Hard as sin to cast but worth it.  
  
Few ways to cheat him.... but what about "hard"casting?  
Actually Bolas deck prove a few solutions already.  
[Obelisk of Grixis](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Obelisk of Grixis) help in case of color screw.  
[Nightscape Familiar](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Nightscape Familiar) gives a nice discount.  
And [Morgue Toad](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Morgue Toad) can be sacced for needed U and R mana.  
But what makes it frightening is that Bolas can be playable in Mono B. Just throw some Dark Rituals to the mix.
